title: How do UPSC toppers manage NCERTs, standard books, optional subjects, and 4-5 times revision in a single year of preparation? - Quora
tags: National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT)
Union Public Service Commission of India

response.answer_text: Single year preparation is not small one but if someone has great focus on his preparation with intense hardwork & discipline like rock lying on groundWe have usually 12 months before appear in prelim exam & 3 months more before taking mains exam so generally someone has 15 months to make his/her name in coveted list of UPSC toppersAs per my knowledge, I want deliver prudential strategies that would help to break through this prestigious exam in a single year of dedicated preparationFirst of all, if someone is going to appear in CSE exam then he/she should be ready to allot his/her 10–12 hrs in study with proper guidance here guidance means not let be misguide distract yourself during your preparation or even until you reach at your destination (LBSNAA)So if someone has 10–12 hrs of time for study then make your study schedule very judiciously like roughly if we talk about he/she could denote 2hrs to read newspaper from his/her daily routineNow move towards NCERT which are very simple books, as per my concern , to cover 6–10th class ncert it will take only one month if you are putting 3hrs of your daily routine & to cover 11–12th class ncert someone will take two months more so in terms of totall time someone will take only 3 months to cover complete ncerts by putting only 3hrs of your study routineNow we have 6–7hrs left so utilise this valuable time in a very calculative way, allot 3hrs for your optional subjects & 2 hrs for 1 standard book whatever you would like to read like polity by Lakshmikant or other thanNow revision that is very crucial thing in whole preparation, it is like we have one more subject so revise all those contents whatever you would read in a week , a/c to me you should make “5 days rule” it means study for 5 days in a week as per your schedule & reserve two days for revision only whatever you have done in 5 days revise all those content in these two days (saturday & sunday), repeat this cycle until your final exam, trust on me this way you could revise 4–5 times very easily so I hope this answer regarding your query is enough
By spending time on quora and other social media sites after cracking the exam, not before it. If you can put in dedicated effort for 6–8 hours daily, it is not that difficult.
